Mr. Damdinsuren, 52 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been teaching conceptual art and artistic skills at a college since 2009. His wife has a position of accountant and works at a military base. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to connect his house to a central heating system. As a result, his family will no longer need to burn coal for heating, and thus release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to connect his house to a central heating system.

loans.name: Delgersaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Delgersaikhan, 36 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people for ten years. His wife operates a barbershop and hires two barbers. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovation of his house.

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en:
Mr.Bayarmunh is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife stays home, providing tailoring services while she takes care of their newborn baby girl and her family. His two sons attend local public school. 

In 2005, Bayarmunh was granted his certification as a Taekwondo trainer and he started his club to teach middle-schoolers. He has regular students, around 25 to 30 per month, to promote a healthy and active living ritual for children. 

Bayarmunh is now requesting loan of MNT 3,000,000 to purchase insulation material to insulate the house, to provide warm and comfortable living conditions to his family during the harsh, Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to insulate the house.

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
La Señora Beronica tiene 55 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras,  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa usada y venta de cameras, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Beronica es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora y sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y también desde su casa de habitación,  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de mangos,  melones, sandias, bananos, manzanas, etc. ya que desea instalar un puesto de frutas frente a su casa y de esta manera generarse otros ingresos que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
Doña Beronica espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
Doña Beronica su sueño es continuar con sus negocio y se convierta en uno de los más reconocidos de la zona.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
Beronica is 55 years old, and she lives in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in the center of Honduras. She has been selling used clothes and bed comforters for three years, and has been doing business for 30 years. 

Beronica is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, and she makes her sales in the street as well as from her home. She needs the loan for the purchase of mangos, melons, watermelons, bananas, apples, etc. as she wishes to install a fruit stand in front of her home, and in this way generate another source of income that will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life a little bit. 

Beronica hopes that the investment she makes for her business will generate enough profits to be able to get ahead with her family, and at the same time hopes that her business will keep growing. Her dream is to continue with her business and convert it into one of the most recognized in the area. 

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: purchase mangoes, melons, watermelons, bananas, apples, etc. for her other business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 47-year-old woman from the town of Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 22, 20 and 13. Her husband worked as a farmer to support their family. She engages in farming. She grows and sells green onions to help augment the income of their household. Her business started more than ten years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer to gain more harvest.

In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsagdorj, 25 years old, lives alone in small brick house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts for two years. He is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as shingles, bricks, vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, he will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Naranhuu is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband has helped her to run their family business of a grocery store in the first floor of their house since they moved to the city from Selenge province. They are self-employed and successfully running their business and make enough profit to cover their family expenses, their daughter's university tuition fee and the health fees of their younger daughter who is not able to go to university and stays home. Their youngest son is 5 and attends local kindergarten. 

Naranhuu is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000MNT to purchase large amounts of organic products from herders and other retailers to sell in her store and increase their profit to start savings for their son's future and education. They are a happy and hardworking family.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic products from herders and other retailers to sell in her store and increase their profit

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with seven children. The youngest child is 15 years old. Her husband worked in maintenance in a private company to support their family. She engages in vegetable farming. She grows and sells pechay to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 2 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional pechay seeds, fertilizers and a sprayer, to improve the harvest.  

In the future, Regina would like expand her farming business and increase business profitability to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional pechay seeds, fertilizers and a sprayer

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulam is 52. She lives with her 12-year-old son Buyan-Orgil in rental apartment in Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Buyan-Orgil attends local high school while his older three siblings are married and live apart.
 
Dulam has been raising her children all by herself for years and now her older three children are married and living by their own with no further help or support from their mother. Dulam has been working as saleswoman in a general store in local market for years and started her own business of cosmetics and other goods general store in local small market. She is trying to improve her living and raise her youngest son as good person with capability of living on his own in future. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter and increase her sales and improve her living.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter in order to increase her sales and improve her living

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Battseren is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Recently, she began working as a cashier at a supermarket. 

Battseren is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 MNT, which she will use to buy furniture such as closet, drawer, sofa, and television. With these items, her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Thy is a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district. She earns a living through farming rice and supplementing the family’s income by working as a tailor. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Thy’s group consists of two members who are both female. Thy is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Thy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district. Selling trash is the main source for her family’s income, and sometimes she also works for others for a fee. Engaged in these businesses for ten years, she is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the eighth loan for Thea’s group of two members, and they both completely paid back their past loans with VisionFund. Thea is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy trash to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy trash to resell.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en: Mrs. Altansuvd, 44 years old, works as physician at hospital in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. She owns a hotel in Ulaanbaatar for extra income. She is requesting a loan of 32,00,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As winter is coming closer, it is necessary to renovate her house. After renovation, she will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar is 47 years old, married, and has children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been working as an organizer at a diplomat corps for 10 years. His wife has position as a CEO at a high school. 

This summer, Erdenebayar raised vegetables and now wants to harvest them. Due to the lack of finance, he cannot afford to do. As winter is coming closer, his vegetables are in danger so he is requesting a loan for 7,000,000 MNT, which he will use to hire workers for harvesting and to rent truck for transporting. By doing so, he can supply his vegetables to local vendors so that people can eat fresh vegetables, which is useful for overall health.

loans.use: to harvest vegetables

loans.name: Turtogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Turtogtokh, 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been crafting sculptures since 2010. His wife runs a grocery store. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years, so he is requesting a loan of MNT 7,500,000 to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and then release less pollutants into the air, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate his home.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afi est âgée de 48ans. Elle n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Depuis 1997, elle vend des produits de détails (eau minérale, produits d’alimentation générale et cartes de recharges) Son activité se fait dans une boutique et par moment elle a des ruptures de stock. Pour pallier à ce problème, elle demande un troisiéme prêt à WAGES pour acheter en quantité considérable des marchandises. Elle veut devenir grossiste et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Afi is 48 years old. She has no dependent children. Since 1997, she has been selling retail products (mineral water, general foodstuffs and mobile phone recharge cards). She conducts her business out of a shop, and she occasionally faces stock shortages. To mitigate this problem, she is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES to buy a substantial quantity of merchandise. She wants to become a wholesaler and be more self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a bicycle transport service where he transports customers using his bicycle. He describes his biggest family challenge to be a lack of enough water storage. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water storage facility that will benefit three family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will sustain himself economically. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 10,000 KES and 20,000 KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. She is from the town of Garcia-Hernandez. Teresita is a farmer, growing and selling tomatoes to help augment the income of their household. She has been a farmer for more than 10 years. 

Teresita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional seedlings, fertilizers, and sprayer. In the future, she would like to expand her farming  business to be a successful entrepreneur and have a sustainable source of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and sprayer

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 42 years old and is married with three school-aged children.

Elisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elisa has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, aged 52, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has nine children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on five hectares of farmland to make a living. She has been in this business for 30 years. She is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day to support the family’s need.

This is the micro loan for Kim’s group of two members who are both female, and she is the first cycled client. Now requesting a loan, Kim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en: Gerlee is a master degree student in public university. She has chosen her major as a psychologist, and she is a very hardworking and passionate student. This loan will help her to pay her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to start producing winter boots before winter to increase his sales and improve his living for his family

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian de 51 años, es una persona que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar; en la actualidad es madre soltera ya que el esposo viajo a Estados Unidos, y luego no tuvo comunicación con ella.  Es así, que ella ha retomado la vos de mando y hacer de su hogar personas responsables, en la actualidad ya solo dos hijos dependen de ella.


Mirian se dedica a la agricultura y a administrar una pequeña tienda, por la mañana trabaja en la agricultura y por la tarde se dedica a la tienda ya que lo que vende son golosinas y licuados de frutas, la tienda tiene cuatro años de tenerla, por lo que trabaja 14  horas todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana hasta en la noche.


Mirian con el préstamo solicitado a fundación Campo, comprara más mercadería, ya que necesita comprar otros insumos como lo es jabón, aceites, champú, y granos básicos así como otros que la misma clientela le busca satisfaciendo su necesidad mejorar su tienda.
Los sueños de Mirian son mejorar la tienda ya que con los años que tiene, ella buscara otra manera de vida, porque en la agricultura el trabajo es más duro, su misión es consolidar su tienda para tener una fuente de ingresos de donde poder sobre vivir.
texts.en:
Fifty-one year old Mirian is a person that didn't have the opportunity to study; currently, she is a single mother since her husband traveled to the United States, and then lost communication with her. Thus, she has picked up the voice of authority and is making responsible people of those in her household. At present, only two children depend on her. 

Mirian works in agriculture, and she manages a small store. In the morning, she is farming, and in the afternoon, she works in the store selling candy and fruit shakes. She has had the store for 4 years, and because of it, works 14 hours every day from 5 in the morning to night.

With the requested loan from Fundación Campo, Mirian will buy more merchandise now that she needs to buy other products such as soap, cooking oils, shampoo, and staple grains among the others that her same customers are looking for, satisfying her need to improve her store. 

Mirian's dreams are to improve her store over the years, and that she will find another way of life because farming work is more difficult. Her mission is to consolidate her store to have a source income from which she'll be able to survive.

loans.use: buy soap, cooking oils, shampoo and staple grains among others that her same customers are looking for, satisfying her need to improve her store.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from three years to 16 years. She describes herself as enthusiastic. She operates a clothing store where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest family challenge to be insufficient water storage. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water container that will benefit five people. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water container.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials to renovate and insulate her house before the harsh, cold Mongolian winter comes and provide decent living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en: Mr. Battumur, 46 years old, lives with his wife and son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He and his wife have been collecting and selling factory wastes such as broken gears, bottles and copper products to Chinese retailers since their retirement. Before this, he and his wife worked as a driver and cook respectively. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy large amounts of waste products from firms. By doing so, his working capital will increase and he can generate more income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy waste products in large amounts.

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en: Mr. Naidan, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2010. Before his transportation business, he sold meat and meat products for living. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, taking care of the domestic work. He is requesting a loan of 4,700,000 MNT to buy winter tires for his truck. By doing so, he can transport goods safely on slippery roads during winter time.

loans.use: to buy winter tires for his truck.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia's greatest wish is having a healthy family and prosperous living conditions with her family. She is 51 years old and married. She has one child. She is engaged in a retailing business, selling rice, grains and various groceries. To get additional income, she is also selling a variety of vegetables and meats. Her income from the business goes for her family's daily household expenditures. 

Rosalia also wants to sell cooked meals and snacks as added offerings. She is thus requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more grocery items like canned goods, vegetables, meat and rice. She hopes to get greater income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like canned goods, vegetables, meat and rice.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and beauty products. She describes her family's challenge to be a lack of enough drinking water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility that will benefit her four family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in business.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a mother of one child already attending school. She is married. She plants and harvests calamansi, a small citrus fruit, on their farm. She learned this business from other calamansi farmers/growers in nearby villages. Marilou also started a business buying and selling calamansi for added income. She has realized that profits from selling calamansi are good enough to sustain their needs. She is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to her planted calamansi. She believes she will harvest more fruits by applying enough inputs to her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for calamansi

loans.name: Saint Antoine De Padou 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 1" est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honorine est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Toussaint. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges du ménage, Honorine prépare depuis sept ans, de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de poissons frits) dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement "SAINT ANTOINE DE PADOU 1", un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Saint Antoine de Padou 1 group is made up of 8 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that the group is requesting a loan through ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The representative of the group is Honorine, and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and married to a man named Toussaint. Together they have four children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. Honorine lives with her husband and children, and together the couple is responsible for the household expenses.

In order to care for the various household needs, Honorine has been preparing and selling food (corn dough with fried fish) in a market in Benin for the last 7 years. This business produces significant earnings. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her business and revenue, Honorine, together with the other members of Saint Antoine de Padou 1, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She is from Jagna, Bohol. Perlita raises and sells pigs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. To earn additional income, she raises vegetables.

Perlita is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy pig feeds, fertilizers, and sprayer.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers, and sprayer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, kales, onions etc. 

Rose describes her family challenge to be travelling long distances to get water. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy cement and sand and pay for the cost of labor to construct a slab for installing a water tank. She already bought the water tank. Her family will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, tubes and flat sheeting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy two shelves and basic products (rice, sugar, beans, etc.)

loans.name: 02.07.05 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Nượt works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.
Nượt is 50 years old, she is married, and has two children.
Nượt is the group leader of the 02.07.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. In 2013, Nượt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nượt has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Nượt has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Nượt faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Nượt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: Srimati

texts.en: Srimati is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in the Jalpaiguri district of Magurmari. She has received her education up to class VIII (grade 8). Her husband is 33 years old and is working as a mason. He has received his education up to class IV (grade 4). Now she is a mother of two children and the elder one is going to class I (grade 1). From BJS she has taken a loan to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products. The earnings from her husband’s business are very low, so she has shifted to another sector so that she can earn more money and run their family. Srimati is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dreams which is to save money so that she can give her children a good future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: G.s San Agustin 2 Group

texts.es:
El señor Denis tiene 32 años de edad, es padre de 2  hijos, vive con su esposa, su actividad es la producción y venta de malanga cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad alterna a la caficultura este tipo de actividad tiene un muy buen mercado tanto local como nacional, ya que tiene una gran demanda por los diferentes tipos de uso que se le da como ser uso de concentrados para alimentos para animales y para uso del consumo humano.
Don Denis al igual que sus compañeros están solicitando el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y demás producto necesario para el cultivo, espera les contribuirá a tener una mayor producción de sus productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Denis su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a su hijo y mejorar las condiciones de vida,
Los demás integrantes se dedican también a la producción de malanga y caficultora y lo integran Héctor que se dedica a la producción de Malanga, Horacio, Josué y José Donatilo.


Danli, Honduras - Octubre 2013
texts.en:
Denis is 32 years old and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife. His work is producing and selling malanga [a vegetable]. He has dedicated himself to this work for more than 10 years, alternating with growing coffee. This type of crop has a very good market both locally and nationally, since there is great demand for the different ways of using it, for example in concentrated feed for animals and for human consumption. 

Mr. Denis, along with his fellow members, is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and other products he needs for his plantings. He hopes that this will contribute to better production of his crop, which will permit him to improve his income to cover family expenses and financial commitments. 

Denis's dreams are to give a good professional education to his son and improve his standard of living. 

The other members also dedicate themselves to growing malanga and coffee. They are made up of Héctor, who grows malanga, Horacio, Josué and José Donatilo.


Danli, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crop.

loans.name: Tsog-Ochir

texts.en:
Tsog-Ochir is 48 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 daughters in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife helps with his grocery store business on their plot of land. 

Tsog-Ochir's daughters are between the ages of 3 and 17. The oldest daughter has enrolled in university this year and they have a university tuition fee to pay for their daughter's education. Tsog-Ochir is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay his daughter's university tuition fee while running his business with no external impact. He is a hardworking, loving and caring person who says, "I have been surrounded by the most beautiful women in my whole life and I need to support every one of them to reach success of their own."

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fee while running his business with no external impact.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Steven

texts.es: Steven de 20 años, tiene 3 años de experiencia en la tarea  de confección. Sus líneas de productos,  son la ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, con la que compite día a día.  Su padre lo introdujo en el oficio, desde muy joven, enseñándole poco a poco las operaciones propias de este oficio y así mismo las aprendió de manera gradual. En su negocio se realizan todas las tareas productivas de la confección: diseño, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas y una vez está lista la prenda de vestir, Steve la vende de contado y también ofrece crédito a clientes, que le compran con una frecuencia semanal, para lo cual Steven trabaja  10 horas diarias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen y de contado telas, hilos, materias primas e insumos, para elaborar prendas ajustadas a la temporada de fin de año, que está muy cerca, en la que usualmente se impactan sus ventas.. Su meta empresarial es lograr el fortalecimiento de su negocio especialmente, aumentando su capital de trabajo, para lograr el incremento de su productividad, y ganar un poco mas de dinero. Steven planea perfeccionarse como sastre sin perder de vista su profesión futura, porque está estudiando en la universidad  y su propósito es convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Steven is 20 years old and he has three years of experience working in the tailoring business. He strives in the competitive market with his clothing line, which features garments for women, men and children.

His father introduced him to this business at an early age, teaching him little by little the skills of this field, which Steven learned gradually overtime.
In his workshop he performs all the tasks related to the production of apparel: design, preparation and assembling, as well as the final touch ups. Once the clothing pieces are ready, Steven sells them to his clients, who purchase from him either in cash or credit. His customers buy from him every week, and for this reason Steven works shifts of 10 hours every day.

At the moment he is requesting his first Kiva loan through the Foundation Mario Santa Domingo, to buy fabrics, threads, materials and supplies in larger quantities, to design special clothing for the holiday season, since it is now near and it usually brings an increase to his sales.

His entrepreneurial goal is to strengthen his business, specifically by increasing his work production to be able to earn more money.
Steven plans to also improve his skills as a tailor, without losing sight of his academic future, as he is currently attending college to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, materials and supplies in larger quantities.

loans.name: Lourdes Fabiola

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer joven que se casó a muy temprana edad pero que en la actualidad es separada de su esposo con quien tuvo 5 hijos. La situación de su separación fue muy difícil de superar pues también implicó la separación con dos de sus hijos. Ahora vive con sus tres hijos menores en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada.
En vista de la necesidad de cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, Lourdes se vio en la necesidad de emprender por iniciativa propia el negocio de la crianza de pollos en el cual invierte al menos 8 horas cada día desde hace 8 años. Ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar pollos y mejorar la estructura de los galpones para de esta forma incrementar la producción y venta de sus animales y por ende las utilidades que genera le servirán para mejorar s situación económica y crecer laboralmente y como persona al poder un día ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. 
Lourdes agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por abrir las puertas para este paso tan importante en su vida.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a young woman who married at a very early age, but who currently is separated from her husband, with whom she had 5 children. The situation of her separation was very difficult to deal with, since it also meant separation from two of her children. She now lives with her three younger children in Los Bancos, a canton in the province of Pichincha, one of the largest in the Republic of Ecuador. This canton is located only a few kilometers from the city of Quito, and it has a diversity of forests. Its towns are populated with friendly people characterized by the typical customs of that city. Also found here are diverse microenterprises operated by entrepreneurs who struggle every day to achieve their dreams. Some of the leading activities are agriculture and livestock raising, producing abundant crops which are later sold and distributed to many other provinces. The area also has various tourist attractions such as waterfalls, rivers, paths and swimming areas, where tourists are attracted by the adventure sport services offered there with guaranteed safety. 

In view of the need to supply the necessities for her children, Lourdes saw the need to start a business on her own initiative, raising chickens. She has invested at least 8 hours a day in this work for the past 8 years. Now she needs a loan to buy chickens and to improve the structure of her pens, so that she can increase the production and sales of her animals. As a result, the profits generated will allow her to improve her economic situation; to grow as a worker and as a person; and one day to see her children become professionals. 

Lourdes is grateful to the Alternativa Foundation and to Kiva for opening the doors for this very important step in her life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and improve the structure of her enclosures.

loans.name: Ada Carmelita

texts.es:
Ada, es soltera, vive con su hermana y su cuñado, es independiente sus gastos, desde hace cuatro años ella atiende su negocio de venta de medicina natural (Herbalife), en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., con el capital comprara herbal aloe, multivitamínicos, fibras naturales, tés, (todo lo necesarios para preparar las diferentes bebidas naturales), 
Con dicha inversión tendrá la materia prima suficiente para trabajar y generar los ingresos necesarios para pagar las cuotas de crédito, mejorar su económica y ampliar la variedad producto que ofrece a sus clientes.
Desea tener un local más amplio para mejorar el servicio que les da a sus clientes y mantenerse trabajando sin ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Ada is single.  She lives with her sister and brother-in-law.  She is independent with her expenses.  She has had her business of selling natural medicine (Herbalife) for four years.  Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m until 4:00 p.m.  She will use the loan to buy herbal aloe, multivitamins, natural fibers, and teas (everything needed to prepare the different natural drinks).

With this investment she will have enough raw materials to work and generate the income needed to make the loan repayments, improve her financial situation, and to expand the variety of products that she offers her customers.

She wishes to have a larger place in order to improve the service she gives her customers and to keep working without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy herbal aloe, multivitamins, natural fibers, and teas

loans.name: Ventura Jose

texts.es: el señor ventura  se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios de transporte en su triciclo desde hace 5 años , es padre de un niño el cual esta  en edad escolar , por el cual se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante esta en secundaria y se esfuerza por mejorar su calidad de vida , el señor trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde. solicita el financiamiento para acondicionar su medio de trabajo y brindarles mejor comodidad a sus clientelas.
texts.en: Ventura has been providing transportation services with his tricycle for five years.  He has one child, who is school age.  Therefore, he puts forth great effort to get him ahead.  He is in high school, and he works hard to improve his quality of life.  Ventura works Mondays through Sundays from six-thirty in the morning until five in the afternoon.  He is requesting the loan to repair his means of transportation and to make his customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair his tricycle and to buy tires and paint.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La señora Gloria María, es comerciante en uno de los barrios de la ciudad de León, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de comida al igual que la venta de productos varios como son: Detergente, jabón de lavar ropa, entre otros productos. Inicia sus labores a las 7:00 am y finalizándolas a las 04:00 pm de lunes a viernes y los sábados y domingo inicia a las  6:00 am y finaliza a las 3:00 pm, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de sus hijos ya que es padre y madre.

El  crédito que  solicito la señora Gloria a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Jabón y Detergente al por mayor, lo cual le permitirá realizar incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su calidad de vida al igual que el de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria María is a merchant in one of León’s neighborhoods.  She makes food to sell and also sells various products like detergent and laundry soap, among others.  She starts working at 7am and ends at 4pm Monday through Friday and on Saturday and Sunday starts at 6am and ends at 3pm.  She’s a single mother of three children and she does this work in order to support her children since she’s both mother and father.

The loan Gloria asked from Ceprodel will be used to buy soap and detergent at wholesale so that she can increase her working capital and improve her and her little ones’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soap and detergent at wholesale.

loans.name: Gladys Raquel

texts.es:
Gladys  tiene 21 años de edad vive actualmente  con su marido  con el que se caso a la edad de 18 años  y tienen un hijo de 2 años , ella antes vivía con sus padres en una comunidad cercana donde estudio su primaria y secundaria . Con su marido  tiene una propiedad con unas cuantas cabezas de ganado la mayoria de las vacas las ordeñan y con la leche de vaca hacen cuajada  para venderla , también se dedican al cultivo de siembra de frijoles. en sociedad con algunos vecinos ella  siembra verduras , como ayotes,calala y granadilla lo que le permite tener otros ingresos extras .
Ella desea un crédito para comprar un sistema solar y tener energía electrica en su hogar ya que actualmente en esta comunidad no llega aun la red de energia convencional
texts.en: Gladys is 21 years old and now lives with her husband with whom she was married at the age of 18. They have a 2 year old child together. Before this she used to live with her parents in a nearby community where she attended primary and secondary school. With her husband she has a property with a number of livestock. The majority of the cows they milk and with this cow's milk they make curd to sell. Furthermore, she plants beans. In partnership with some neighbours she also plants vegetables such as pumpkins and passion fruit, giving her other forms of income. She is requesting a loan to buy solar panels so that she can have electricity at home, since currently her community is not connected to the conventional electricity network.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system so that she can have light in her home

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
A 42-year-old mother of three children who are all in school, Maritess is married to a man who has his own stall where he offers shoe repair services. Three years ago  Maritess started a small business stall in the market. She strives hard to reinvest profits into her enterprise so that someday her children will have something to inherit and depend on. 

Maritess is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy stocks of grocery items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, soap, etc. She dreams to see her children finish their studies for a better future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Izaura Eliza

texts.es:
La joven IsauraEliza vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja  como secretaria en una empresa del estado  soltera, estudiante universitaria.
Esta joven es muy emprendedora ya que se esfuerza día  a día para cumplir su compromiso de trabajo y estudio a la vez, ya que está terminando su carrera de ingeniería industrial.
Isauraestá solicitando un crédito a kiva  para hacer el pago de graduación y títulouniversitario.
texts.en:
Young Isaura Eliza lives in Managua and works as a secretary in a government office; she’s single and a university student.  

This young woman is very enterprising and she strives daily to meet her work obligations and study at the same time since she’s finishing her industrial engineering courses.  She’s asking for a Kiva loan to pay for graduation and for her final degree costs.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es: la señora Maria Yadira se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa interior y visuterias desde hace 23 años en el mercado antes la señora vendia ambulante pero con el tiempo logro ubicarse en un sector del mercado, la señora es madre de tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos depende de ella. la señora se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su hijo, por mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su negocio y aprovechar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Yadira has been selling underwear and costume jewelry for 23 years in the market; she used to sell from place to place but in time succeeded in getting a permanent site in the market.

She’s mother of three children one of whom is still dependent on her.  She’s strives to move her son forward and improve quality of life.  She’s asking for financing to buy merchandise for her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: la señora Luisa Emilia se dedica a la actividad de venta de fricciones  y respuestos para vehiculos desde hace 14 años , es madre soltera de tres hijos  de los cuales ninguno depende de ella , la señora se esfuerza por sacar adelante su hogar, y brindarse una mejor calidad de vida, la señora vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde solicita el financiamiento para comprar fricciones a precio favorable ya que se las estan vendiendo y desea aprovechar el precio para sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia has sold brakes and auto spare parts for 14 years.  She’s a single mother of three children none of which still depend on her.  She strives to move her home ahead and provide better quality of life for herself.

She sells Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon and is asking for financing to buy brakes at a good prices because she’s selling them well and wants to take advantage of the price for her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and parts.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher cultivates his five-hectare corn farm and raises hogs in his locality. He is happily married and has two children. Both his children are still attending school. Christopher's wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker(OFW).

Christopher would like to take out a loan of PHP50,000 which will allow him to buy livestock feed and medicine. He knows that with this loan, he could ensure proper nutrition for his hogs. He hopes and prays that his livestock business will further improve so that his two children could finish their studies and obtain a greater income someday.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and medicine for his hogs.

loans.name: Dolores De La Paz

texts.es:
Dolores, es una señora casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, hace tres años debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos estableció una pupuseria  en su casa lo ha  ido ampliando poco a poco. No ha tenido dificultad para atenderlo. Con el crédito aumentara su inventario comprando carne, papel, bolsas, quesillo, bebidas (variadas), chicharrón, mesas, sillas, etc., todo con el fin de mejorar el servicio y atención a sus clientes.
Dolores tiene como prioridad generar ingresos con los que mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia, cancelar la deuda adquirida y seguir ampliando su negocio.
Su sueño es ir adquiriendo un patrimonio para darles a sus hijos un futuro sin necesidades que les obstaculicen la su superación académica.
texts.en: Dolores is a married woman and lives with her husband and two children. Three years ago, due to the need to generate revenue, she established a pupusería (a place which sells pupusas, which is a El Salvadoran filled tortilla). She ran this pupusería from her home and it has been growing gradually. She has not had difficulties meeting this growth. With this loan she will increase her stock, buying meat, paper, bags, cheese, drinks (various kinds), pork, tables, chairs etc. all in order to improve the service and attention she provides to her customers. Dolores' priority is to generate revenues to improve the quality of live of her family, to pay off debts that she has acquired and keep building her business. Her dream is to build up an estate to give her children a future where all their needs are met, and remove any obstacles to their academic achievement.

loans.use: to buy meat, paper, bags, cheese, drinks (various kinds), pork, tables, chairs etc

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes and repairs clothes. Samuel describes his family challenge to be lack of enough water storage. He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shilling) loan to buy a water storage facility that will benefit four family members.They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. This is Samuel's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
Originally from Sangke district of Battambang province, Bai is 29 years old and blessed with two sons who are still in school. Her main source of income is solely from her vegetable garden and vegetable selling business. She has been with this business for 20 years, earning about 41,700 KHR per day. She can save about 8,600 KHR per day after deducting necessary expenses. 

This is the first micro-loan for Bai with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She is now applying for 3,500,000 KHR in order to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay a plowing fee for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide and to pay a plowing fee for her crop.

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en:
Ouk, age 63 and the mother of five children, is a villager from Kampong Cham province. She and her husband cover their daily cost of living via rice farming on two hectares of farmland. Ouk has been engaged in this business since she was 20 years old, and she is able to generate about 37,200 KHR per day. 
 
This will be Ouk's first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of a group of three borrowers. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizer for her crop. Her goal is to triple last year's crop yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 25-year-old married father of two. He has been working as a barber for fourteen years. He had to quit school and start working early to help his parents, because they couldn't afford to pay for his education fees.

He is a hard worker who is putting much effort into financially supporting his family and improving their living conditions. His childhood wasn't like any child dreams about, which is why he works hard to keep his beloved children from experiencing the same.

Moustafa started his own business in 2001, opening his own barber shop to develop his and his family's socioeconomic situation. He is well known in his region with his good reputation and the hard work he puts in to develop his work and please his family's and customers' needs.

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car, which he will use to expand his working zone and services. He will use this car to serve his customers in a better way by providing them haircuts at their homes or businesses upon request. Through developing his career, he is working hard to make his dream come true, which is to provide his children the best life and the best education ever.

He hopes that in the future he will be capable of buying his own shop instead of spending money on rent expenses.

loans.use: To buy a car which he will use to increase his working services.

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es: la señora Julia se dedica a la actividad de venta de mariscos  como pescado fresco, conchas,  desde hace 6 años en el mercado santa ana , ahi vende de lunes a sabado desde las cinco de la mañana recibe su producto hasta las dos de la tarde, la señora es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales dos dependen de ella, se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante  tanto su negocio como su calidad de vida, la señora solicita el financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de quintales de pescado pargo que es el mas caro y asi ofrecerles a sus clientes el producto que mas buscan
texts.en: Julia has been selling seafood like fresh fish and conch at the Santa Ana market for six years. She sells from Monday to Saturday from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. She has five dependent children. She works hard to make her business prosper and to improve her standard of living. She has applied for a loan to buy quintals of snapper, which is the most expensive, so that she can offer her customers the merchandise they want.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, snapper, mackerel, conch, and turtle eggs.

loans.name: Yoseling Solvey

texts.es:
La joven Yoseling Solvey, es trabajadora en una de las industrias de la ciudad de León, desempeñando el cargo de operaria desde hace cuatro años. Sale de su casa a las 5:30 am e inicia sus labores desde 06:00 am hasta las 02:00 pm este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, es madre soltera de 1 hijo. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su hijo ya que es padre y madre.

El  crédito que  solicito la joven Yoseling a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Zinc, Perlines, golosos, pago de mano de obra, lo cual le permitirá realizar mejoras al techo de su vivienda brindándole un mejor confort tanto para el como a su pequeño hijo y mejorando su calidad de vida del mismo.
texts.en:
Yoseling Solvey has been working as operator during the last 4 years, in one of the manufacturing industries in the city of León. She leaves her house at 5:30 am and works from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm every day, from Monday to Friday. 

She works to support her son, as she is a single mother and she is the primary caregiver.

The loan that Yoseling is requesting through Ceprodel will be used to buy metal roofing sheets, purlins, bolts, and to cover labor costs, in order to improve her home´s roofing, giving better comfort to her child and improving quality of life for him.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing sheets, purlins, bolts, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun, age 31, is an industrious farmer who strives to earn a living via rice farming. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and is able to generate about 17,800 KHR per day. She and her husband have six children. 

Sokun is a new borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of a group of five borrowers. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking loans in the amount of 300,000 KHR, whereas the remaining members are applying for 200,000 KHR each. Sokun will use her loan funds to buy potash and insecticide and to pay plowing fees. 

She is confident that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can gradually improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Rapha (1) Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers is called Rapha 1 and consists of 11 micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. 

Roll (pictured with his hand raised) is one of the members of this group. He earns an income through selling different kinds of beverages and has operated his business for about four years. He tells us that his biggest challenge is dealing with the heavy rains during the rainy season, as this discourages customers from coming to his store. He and his wife have a nine-month-old baby.

Roll is very excited to be receiving his sixth loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off his previous loans. With this next loan, he will be able to buy more of each of the beverages that he sells so that he can further grow his inventory. By buying in bulk, he can get his merchandise at a discounted price from his supplier and increase his profit margins. He says that one of the keys to his success so far has been his practice of selling on credit, which has created great customer loyalty. 

Roll hopes to continue to grow and diversify his store in the future. With his future profits, he dreams of opening a restaurant someday or even owning a taxi. 

He thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is a 53-year-old mother of seven children, three of whom are in school. The main source of her family income is from rice farming on two and half hectares of farmland. It is the business that she has had for several years. 

Lim, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has full paid back her past loans, has managed to utilize her past loans wisely to upgrade her living condition and to keep her kids in school. However, the tuition fee of one of her kids who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Accounting is getting more burdensome for her family. Therefore, Lim decided to take an education loan from VisionFund to overcome this challenge. She hopes that she can support her daughter to fulfill her dream and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Lisa's Group

texts.en:
Lisa is 35 years old and a mother of two dependent children.  She resides in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer, who grows cassava as the main source of income.

This is not the first-time loan for Lisa with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which she used wisely to support her business seasonably.  Now, in this group of two, she is the leader. She is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR, whereas her co-borrower is applying for 1,250,000 KHR. Lisa will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay a plowing fee, and to buy insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business, so that she can improve her living, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for domestic use

loans.name: Sengesuren

texts.en: Mrs. Sengesuren, 26 years old, lives with her sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a loan officer in the banking sector since 2009. Her sister recently began working as a nurse at a hospital. Sengesuren is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in the cities because it produces no harmful pollution from the tailpipe coming from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The electric car will be used by her to provide taxi service during her day off.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es una mujer casada de 42 años que vive junto a su esposo en su casa de madera, tiene el orgullo de haber criado a sus hijos como personas de bien. Cirila se desempeña en labores agrícolas con el apoyo de su esposo y de trabajadores en unos terrenos que compró hallándose con árboles de cacao siendo este uno de los productos más rentables de su región. Desde que empezo a trabajar con este producto trata en cada campaña llevar una producción orgánica por tener un mejor precio en el mercado. Le agrada mucho su trabajo y en especial la hora del almuerzo ya que puede estar al aire libre con su esposo para posteriormente reanudar las labores de mantenimiento como el retiro de maleza, aplicación de abono; entre otros. Para lograr trabajar sin contratiempos debe de contar con dinero para  la compra de herramientas y fertilizantes orgánicos que compra al por mayor para obtenerlos a bajo precio. Desea con el tiempo seguir trabajando para obtener dinero y cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo que es la compra de un burro que le ayude a sacar sus granos de cacao secos en los sacos para llevarlos hasta los centros de acopio en su localidad. Este es su segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y hasta el momento ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago y devolución del dinero. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en: Cirila is a 42 year old woman who lives alongside her husband in their wooden house. She is proud to have raised her children well. Cirila carries out agricultural work with the help of her husband and works on several pieces of land that she bought having come across cocoa trees with this being one of the most profitable products in her region. Since she started working with this product she undertakes organic production each season so that she can gain a better price on the market for her crop. She likes her job a lot, especially lunch hour as she can be outdoors with her husband, then later resume maintenance work such as weed removal, applying fertilizer etc.  To achieve work without setbacks she has to have money to buy tools, and bulk organic fertilizers, buying them wholesale in order to get them at low prices. Over time she wants to keep working in order to earn money and fulfil one of her main long-term objectives, which is to buy a donkey which will help her to carry her dried cocoa beans in bags to the collection centres in her area. This is her second loan with this financial institution and she has to date complied promptly with the payment and reimbursement of the loan. In this loan she would like to obtain 1000 Nuevos Soles in order to buy organic compost.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Selnia Sugey

texts.es: la señora Selnia se dedica a la actividad de libreria y pulperia en el barrio el Calvario desde hace cinco años, esta estudiando en la universidad es casada y es madre de una niña , es una joven que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su niña y a su calidad de vida junto a su negocio,  su dia de trabaja empieza desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, la joven solicita financiamiento para aprovechar los precios comodos  que hay en las ferias en la capital de utiles escolares ya que en diciembre suben de precio y nesecita surtir de mercaderia la libreria. sueña con tener su propia casa  y seguin con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms Selnia has made a living through her book and grocery store in the Calvario neighbourhood for the last five years. She studies at the university, is married and the mother of a girl. She's a young lady who works hard to bring up her child and improve her quality of life and her business. Her work days begin at six thirty in the morning and finish around seven at night.

The young lady requests a loan to be able to take advantage of the current good prices for school supplies at the fairs in the capital, as in December the prices go up and she needs stock for her book shop. She dreams of owning her own house and carrying on with her business.

loans.use: buy university notebooks, small notebooks, books and school supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: la señora Rosa Elena se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa en el mercado desde hace 2 años, madre de un niño pequeño no estudia todavia, es casada, con poco capital inicio su negocio con el fin de tener el sustento diario para su familia, vende de lunes a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, la señora solicita el financiamiento para surtir su negocio con mercaderia como blumes de niña y de adulto, calsetas, bracieras y tener mas mercaderia para ofrecerles a sus clientes y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa Elena has been selling clothing at the market for two years. She has a young son, who does not yet attend school, and is married. She started her business with little capital so that she could support her family. She sells on Monday to Sunday from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She has applied for a loan to buy more business inventory like girl's and women's bloomers, stockings, and bras to offer her customers and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy bloomers, bras, camisoles, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Tuvshinbat

texts.en: Mr.Tuvshinbat is 23 years old and lives with his father in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He has started providing professional photography services to local residents since he learned all those photography techniques from his father. He has been operating his business successfully for a while, but he needs additional tools to continue providing his business as a complete service. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase photography service tools to continue providing his business. He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and talented man.

loans.use: to purchase photography service tools to continue providing his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie owns one hectare of corn farmland and raises hogs for sale. He is a hardworking husband and a responsible father to his two children. Regie has been raising hogs for over five years. He is thankful, because through his hard work, financial assistance and the help of his wife, he was able to improve his hog-raising business.

Now, he is requesting another loan, amounting to PHP20,000. This loan will be used to buy hog feed and necessary vitamins, so his hogs will be healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan, so he could secure his family's future and educate his two children someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for his hogs' optumum health and growth

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, 57, is married and has six children. Struggling for a living, he drives a motorcycle for a fee while his wife sells clothes to earn additional income. He has been involved in his current occupation for more than 10 years. This is not a first time loan for Sambath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of his past loan has enabled him to maintain his lifestyle at a gradual pace and to keep his kids in school. 

For this loan cycle, he is teaming up with another to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sambath will spend his loan portion to fix his motorcycle, and will use a portion to support his kids’ education costs. He hopes that he can fix his motorcycle on time and continue his job to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To fix his motorcycle.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is a young man residing in Stoeung Meanchey district of Kandal province. He is 27 years old and a single man who strives for a living via his cotton scarf weaving business. Sophea is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Marketing as it will support his current business nicely. Therefore, he will spend his entire loan to pay his school fees. He hopes that he can fulfill his dream of holding a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Bau's Group

texts.en:
Bau is 49 years old and a widowed mother of six children residing in Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. Her main source of income is solely from rice farming which she has been involved in for 20 years. It has returned her almost 38,500 KHR per day. 

She and her co-borrowers in a group of three are seeking a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan enabled her to stablize her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, Bau will spend her entire loan portion to buy pigs, ducks, and chickens for raising to earn additional income. Besides, she will use some portion of her loan to buy a decent bike for commuting and to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to gain  good income from her business.

loans.use: To buy pigs, ducks, and chickens for raising to earn additional income

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es: La señora Martha Jacoba se dedica a la actividad de venta de golosinas, elabora piñatas por encargos y se defiende con una pequeña pulperia que la tiene ubicada en el municipio de el Viejo desde hace 14 años, la señora es casada madre de tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, es una señora que se esfuerza por salir adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo en su negocio, solicita el financiamiento para compra de mercaderia para su negocio el cual nesecita surtirlo para mantener sus ingresos.
texts.en: Martha Jacoba sells sweets and makes pinatas to order. She has had a small grocery shop in the town of Viejo for 14 years. She is married and the mother of three grown children. She strives to get ahead, working from Monday to Sunday at her business. She has applied for a loan to buy needed business inventory to maintain her income.

loans.use: to buy yogurt, sweets, snacks, sodas, gum, and candies.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 20-year-old, single man who has been working as an electrician for three years. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing his work and his living because he is responsible for the lives of three members of his family. Youssef is well-known for his hard work and special talents in his domain, which he always works on developing, to make sure that he can support his family's living and develop his business.

Youssef is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy the necessary tools and equipment for a project he is working on.

He hopes to expand his working zone and cover neighboring villages, to expand his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and equipment for a project he is working on.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarjargal, 35 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been teaching at high school since 2007. His wife has a position as a bookkeeper, at a private firm.

The house his family lives in has been deteriorated over the years. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT, which he will use to buy building and insulation materials for house renovation.  These will include materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials for home renovations

loans.name: Kinole Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her early 50s, is a widow with five children, two sons and three daughters. One of them is still at school. For ten years now, Zaituni has been running a genge, a small grocery shop, selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily, and is able to make a good return per month. 

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Zaituni used her previous loans to buy more fruits and vegetables which she resold. Zaituni has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She used her business profit to build a house, and also to put electricity and water in her new house. She paid school fees and some part of the home expenses. Zaituni will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell. She dreams of building a nice house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "KINOLE" which consists of 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Proem

texts.en:
Proem, in her mid-50s and a mother of seven children, is also a resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where she grows her rice and cassava. The business that she has been involved with for ages has returned her about 27,600 KHR per day. 

This is the fifth cycle loan for Proem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan wisely to support her agribusiness on time.  Now, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay a weeding fee and a reaping fee for her cassava, and she will spend some portion of her loan to buy a cow for raising. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee and a reaping fee for her cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of clean water. Margaret will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy cement, sand and for the cost of labour to construct a slab for installing a water tank which she bought. Her family will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and for the cost of labour to build a new water tank slab

loans.name: L'oeil De Dieu (2) Group

texts.en:
Synthia is one of the members of the group Loeil de Dieu (2). The group consists of nine micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Synthia is a single mother of three children whose ages range from 3 to 13 years old. She is very excited to be receiving her first loan from HOPE Congo. She has had her business for around three years. Her business consists of selling prepaid telephone cards as well as SIM cards for various cellular providers in Congo. 

With this next loan she will be able to buy more of each of these items to further grow her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce her costs, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling market. With future profits she hopes to further expand her business and build a home for her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for prepaid minutes charge cards, SIM cards, and telephones.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Khun, age 42 and a mother of eight children, four of whom are in school, is a citizen from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. 

For her family, rice farming is the only source of income. Khun has been involved in the current business for ten years. This is not the first loan for Khun with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to buy a decent hand-tractor to support her agribusiness. 

Now, Khun teams up in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, Khun will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married father of one child. Hhe has been working in selling used car spare parts since 2005 to make his family's living. 

Ali is a hard worker. He seeks perfection in his business and works on expanding and increasing his business capital to make sure that he can reply to any customer request. 

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a motorcycle necessary for his business development. He will use it to make his business easier, moving from one place to another faster during his search for new spare parts which he'll buy to sell in his shop.

He hopes to keep on developing his business in a way that he might start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle necessary for his business development

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 35 year old woman from the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 11, 8, 4 and 2 respectively. She operates a motorcycle service. Her business started five years ago. Lisa is asking for a loan to buy tires, a side mirror and also for stock for her rtw, ready to wear, business. Aside from running a transportation service, Lisa sells ready to wear apparel like shorts, t-shirts, pants and blouses.

In the future, Lisa would like to expand her motorcycle services and her ready to wear business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a side mirror and stock for her rtw, ready to wear, business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bigger amount of vegetables and frruits like beans, cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes, squash and bananas.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is 61 years old, widowed, and lives at Sta. Felomina, Dipolog City. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs. She will use the loan to buy two piglets for her to earn additional income. Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she obtained the capital to purchase two additional piglets and feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to providing her with income. Someday she plans to renovate her pig cage to keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 25 years old. She is a mother who has one school-age child. She helps her husband in generating income by planting vegetables in their back yard. She also buys stock of vegetables, which she sells in the market. Ailyn aims to improve the business to generate a higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of eggplants, lady fingers, bitter melons, beans, squash and tomatoes to sell. She believes that she will make further improvements in her business through this financial assistance coupled with patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggplants, lady fingers, bitter melons, beans, squash and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en:
Gumersinda joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2006. She appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to buy additional stock of fish to sell.  

Gumersinda dreams of nothing more than to live a happy, healthy life and earn an adequate income from her business.
