loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 45-year-old single woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. 

She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean and sufficient water. She will use the 14,000 KES (Kenya shillings) loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for family use. She hopes that in the future, she will access clean and safe water for family use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Wendy Lizbeth

texts.es: Wendy es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra desempleada y, debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa su familia, se motivó para iniciar su propio negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Quiere empezar con la venta de productos por catálogo y por encargos, aprovechando todos los contactos de las redes sociales para ofrecer sus productos; esta actividad la comenzará de manera empírica, y espera que le brinde los resultados esperados. Su espíritu de superación y su dinamismo la llevan a buscar  alternativas que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cosméticos, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros) aprovechando los descuentos y las promociones que le ofrecen, de esta manera podrá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo y, aunque es consciente de que su principal desafío es que en el mercado hay mucha competencia directa, eso no la detiene para seguir avanzando, pues manifiesta que prestar un excelente servicio al cliente será el valor agregado que ofrecerá a sus compradores. Wendy quiere dedicarse a trabajar con empeño, disciplina y dedicación para lograr acreditar su negocio y que éste le dé buena rentabilidad para poder disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable y lograr que su negocio perdure en el tiempo, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is an enterprising 21 year-old who is currently unemployed.  Due to her family's difficult financial situation, she was motivated to start her own business to generate the income needed to support the household.  She wants to start selling products through a catalog and through orders, offering her products to all of the contacts in her social network.  She will start the business and see if it provides her with the results she hopes for.  

Wendy's resilient spirit and dynamism are leading her to seek out alternatives to get ahead. To do this, she is requesting the support of a loan so that she can purchase merchandise at wholesale (perfumes, cosmetics, body creams, accessories, and other items), taking advantage of the discounts and promotions that are offered.  This way she can start up her productive enterprise.  Although she is aware that her main challenge is the high level of competition in the market, this does not deter her from continuing forward.  She states that her excellent customer service will be the added value that she offers to her buyers.  

Wendy wants to devote herself to her work, with effort, discipline and dedication, so that she can get her business recognized.  This will give her good profitability so that she will be able to enjoy financial stability and ensure that her business will keep going over time, thereby improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, body creams, accessories, etc).

loans.name: Shahboz

texts.ru: Шахбоз после успешного окончания средней школы поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Он учится на первом курсе. Шахбоз учится по специальности Таможенное дело. Шахбоз в процессе учебы в университете сталкивается с трудностями, но он всегда работает над своими знаниями и часто посещает библиотеку. Он еще не женился и живет с родителями относительно далеко от его университета. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
After successful completing high school, Shahboz enrolled in Tadjik State University of Commerce. He is a first-year student, specializing in Customs. Shahboz has faced some challenges during his studies, but is always working on his them and is often found in the library. 

He is not yet married, and lives with his parents relatively far from the university. His parents are not in a position to pay his tuition. He is asking for a loan to pay his tuition fees. Shahboz awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Marwina

texts.en: Marwina is 29 years old and blessed with two children. She is engages in cooking and selling of food snacks in their community. This is her way of helping her husband in generating income. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she needed to earn more income to cover up their necessities. She plans to prepare more kinds of snacks to sell but she does not have enough capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional of PHP 5,000 to buy flour, sugar, coconuts, milk and other ingredients needed in preparing and cooking native snacks to sell in the local community. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will make further improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, coconuts, milk and other ingredients needed in preparing and cooking native snacks to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Elsa has a shop that sells grains. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional grains. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grains.

loans.name: Victor Junior

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos,el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Victor se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica para ser Bartender.
Por iniciativa propia, Victor trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de patos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales para construir corrales adecuados y seguros para sus aves, de esta manera desea aumentar la cantidad de patos para su venta, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Victor is 20 and single. He lives in Cañete in the Imperial district with his parents and siblings. He is hardworking and enthusiastic and strives to get ahead and support his parents. Victor is taking bartending classes. Victor is a field worker for a municipal agriculture foundation and also raises and sells turkeys. He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks that his dedication and efforts are helping him do well. 

Victor thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will allow him to buy building supplies to make appropriate and safe pens for his turkeys. He wants to increase the number of turkeys he has for sale. Then he will keep working to achieve his great dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to build pens.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 43 years old and married. She lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines. In order to help her family, she operates a sari-sari store (convenience store). She began her business with PHP 4,000 in start-up capital and was able to expand it with the help of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits provided by the co-op. 

Now Cecilia is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. Expanding her inventory will enable her to earn additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain her membership in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and provide a good education to her children. In the future, Cecilia wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies so that they can help her in the future. 

Being a member in good standing of the cooperative, Cecilia has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family. Cecilia is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: to restock her inventory for her sari-sari store (convenience store).

loans.name: Arzel

texts.en:
Arzel is from  Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is 43 years old and is married. 

In 2012, Arzel applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Arzel has requested financial assistance of  5,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store (general store). Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of basic commodities for her sari-sari store (general store)

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is 66 years old and lives in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with five children. 

Santiago has a mini-grocery store to make his living. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan  to purchase additional inventory for his mini-grocery store.

Santiago has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Santiago hopes to have more savings for his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for his mini-grocery store.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 64 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children.  

Felicisima has a shop that sells grain. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan  to purchase additional grain.

Felicisima has been a member of PMPC for eleven years.  In the future, Felicisima hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grain.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 14 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; Evelio es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. Evelio tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Evelio lives with his life partner and his 14-year-old son, who is a student. He owns a metal workshop, where he makes doors, balconies, grills, and other items. He has had the business for several years and has a lot of experience that helps his improve his work each day. His business has been successful, and he has many customers, who come because he offers quality work, affordable prices, and, most of all, items designed to their tastes. 

Evelio is hardworking, honest, and modest. He is always seeking opportunities that can lead to success. He wants to grow his business, but he needs capital to buy materials. He has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy iron, metal, tools, and more. Evelio has good credit references and is certain he can pay his debt while making his household financially secure.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, and more.

loans.name: Harlen

texts.en:
Harlen is married with three children. Harlen is 41 years old and lives in Maribojoc,Tudela, Philippines.

Harlen is a farmer and grows  corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies and chemicals such as magnum roach killer, soluble powder, creep feeders, shutters and inlets, etc.

Harlen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Harlen hopes to improve and expand her business and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies and chemicals such as magnum roach killer, soluble powder, creep feeders, shutters and inlets, etc.

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалил 49-летний житель города Душанбе. Он женат имеет 18-летнюю дочь и троих сыновей в возрасте 23, 20 и 14 лет. Его жена домохозяйка, дочь и младший сын учатся в школе, один сын служит в армии, а другой работает водителем. Абдухалил 2 года назад открыл свою фасфудную лавку рядом с рынком. Сейчас там работают его отец и брат. Абдухалил очень целеустремленный человек. Он взял в аренду маленькое помещение и хочет использовать его как продуктовый магазин. Сумму кредита он хочет потратить на закуп продуктов питания, в том числе масла, сахара, муки, соли, вафель, печенье, макаронов, лапшы, йогурта и многих других. Будущий магазин находится рядом с домом. Магазин будет семейным, так как вся его семья, состоящие из его отца, брата, жены и детей стараются для открытия магазина.
texts.en: Abduhalil is 49, married, and lives in the city of Dushanbe. He has an 18 year old daughter and three sons, ages 23, 20, and 14. His wife is a homemaker, his daughter and youngest son are in school, one son is serving in the army, and the other works as a cab driver. Abduhalil opened a fast food shop near the marketplace two years ago, and now his father and brother work there. He is a very determined person and has rented a small space near his home to use as a grocery store. He wants to use the loan to purchase food products, including butter, sugar, flour, salt, waffles, cookies, pasta, noodles, yogurt, and many others. His father, brother, wife and children are all working hard to open the store, so it will be a family-run business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Doña Seidy es una mujer de 55 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero. Es trabajadora y esforzada por cumplir sus metas. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante de ventas por catálogos  y zapatos. Primero ve su hogar y luego sale a ofrecer su mercadería. Tiene varios años de obtener ingresos de esa manera sin descuidar a su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero y un hijo en las decisiones a tomar. En su crédito anterior fue responsable y puntual. Una de sus metas es aumentar su cartera, asi sus ventas para superarse como persona, socializarse más y mantenerse ocupada en algo que la lleve al éxito, por eso solicita otra vez financiamiento. Va a invertir en la línea de zapatos, también en mercadería de catálogos, debido a que sus clientes le han pedido.
texts.en: Seidy is 55 years old and lives with her life partner. She works hard without ceasing until she meets her goals. She is a travelling sales woman offering both shoes and a variety of items from catalogues. Customers can browse catalogs in her own home, or they may make purchases on the street.  She obtained much of her income this way over the years without neglecting her family. She has much support from her partner and her son in her decision making. With her last loan, she was responsible and punctual, repaying in full. One of her goals is to increase her number of customers, thus bettering herself as a person, being more social and occupying her time with a job that she enjoys and in which she finds success.  She is looking for financial support in order to accomplish this.  She is going to invest in a line of shoes as well as catalog merchandise (responding to customers’ requests).

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 48-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Tubod, San Juan, Siquijor, industriously caring for her fishing activities.  She is married and has four children.  She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. 

The business is doing well.  Vivian has humbly taught her children the technique of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Vivian sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting  14,900.00 PHP (Philippines Pesos) from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a good education for her children and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing supplies and fish

loans.name: Gilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Gilmer de 44 años, con mucho esfuerzo propio y de sus padres logro sacar un noveno grado en la escuela donde estudiaba; ya que tenia que trabajar todos los días con su padre en la agricultura por las mañanas y por las tardes estudiaba, esto era de todos lo días y los fin de semana trabajaba todo el día, luego de esto ya no pudo sostener sus estudios, debido a que tenia que viajar a la ciudad y la condición económica de sus padres no le permitía hacerlo.

Es casado y padre y 4 hijos, dos de ellos están estudiando un bachillerato y uno un noveno grado, el otro ya se aparto y formo su propia familia, su esposa trabaja vendiendo pupusas por las tardes y en los lugares donde hay convivios u otros eventos. Sus hijos y su señora son los que dependen de él.

Él se dedica a trabajar la agricultura y ademas al cuido del ganado, lo ha realizado desde que estaba muy pequeño y le enseño su padre quien se dedicaba a esta misma actividad; ademas le enseño a trabajar como albañil, estas actividades las ha realizado desde que estaba muy joven ya que eran una de las fuentes de ingresos, que le generaban para la familia. Sus trabajos los realiza a un kilómetro de su casa, tiene que madrugar para llegar muy temprano y terminar por la mañana, cuando se dedica a la albañilería trabaja todo el día, luego por las tardes le ayuda a su esposa en la venta y su  hijo le ayuda en la agricultura.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo. Se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción y tener mejores ingresos para su familia.

 Sus sueños en sus hijos es,  darles el estudio ya que manifiesta que tienen el deseo, de alcanzar una meta universitaria, las ganancias de la agricultura las utiliza en la compra de ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
Gilmer Antonio is 44 years old.  With great effort on his own and from his parents he was able to complete ninth grade in the school where he studied, since he had to work every day in the morning with his father in agriculture and then study in the afternoon.  This was his schedule every week day, and on the weekends he worked all day. Later he was not able to sustain his studies, since he had to travel to the city and the economic condition of his parents did not allow it. 

He is married and father to four children, two of whom study in high school and one in ninth grade.  The other has already moved out and begun his own family.  His wife works selling pupusas in the afternoon in locations where there are gatherings and other events.  His children and his wife all depend on him.

He works in agriculture and also raises cattle.  He has been doing this work since the time he was very young and his father taught him because he worked in the same field.  He also taught Gilmer bricklaying.  He has been working in these fields from a very young age since this was his source of income, and he generated it for the family.  He works one kilometer from his home, and he has to get up very early and finish by morning, when he works as a brick layer and works all day.  In the afternoon he helps his wife with sales and his son helps him with agriculture.  The loan will be used to purchase agricultural items: fertilizers and man power for preparing the fields for cultivation.  He hopes to improve his corn crop and at the end of harvest have a larger output and better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural items: fertilizers and man power for preparing the fields for cultivation.

loans.name: Shelden

texts.en:
Shelden is from Candanay Norte, Siquijor. She is 45 years old and is married with 5 children who are school-aged. 

This year, Shelden applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She has maintained the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Shelden has asked for financial assistance of Php 50,000.00 to buy concrete, wood, sand and gravel for home renovations. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her house. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy concrete, woods, sand and gravel for home renovations

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 41 years old and lives in Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. 

In order to help her family, aside from selling rice cakes, she also produces foods such as biscuits and bread. 

This year, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC, with good credit standing. She wants to obtain a  loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more ingedients for her food production because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. 

She plans to send her children to college, so that they can help her in the future, and to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, such as flour, baking soda, sugar, and fruits

loans.name: Maria Gladys

texts.es: María  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, desea realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and others.  She has been in her business for many years.  This has gifted her with sales experience that allows her to get better income.  It is located at her house, which is in a heavily traveled area.  She has gained a lot of customers.  She has the most stocked store, and people prefer her because she always has what they need with quality products, affordable prices, and incomparable service.  She is always as her customers’ disposal.

She wants to make a new investment, but she needs capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy basic grains, candy, eggs, bread, and drinks, etc.  She will do this in order to get improved income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, eggs, bread, and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yannick Ismael

texts.en: Yannick is a young Cameroonian, aged 29, married with five children. The oldest is in their second year in primary school while the youngest is two years old and in pre-nursery school. He has been in this business for the past two years, which makes him experienced and stable. His business is profitable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area where there are many potential customers. This loan will help him increase his turnover by 25 percent and his standard of living will also improve.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 62 años de edad, se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, como hayacas, pasteles y también ofrece a su clientela mercancía variada como ropa. Desde hace 4 años inició su negocio, pues aprovechó sus potencialidades y aptitudes para cocinar. Ella inició preparando hayacas (amasijos al que agregan carnes y/o pollo y/o credo, verduras, arroz, masa, aceitunas alcaparras etc. y son envueltos en hojas de plantas y atados con pitas, para la cocción)  Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y sus compras de contado, trabajando diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Entre sus clientes hay quienes también solicitan a crédito ropa y ella para generar otro ingreso, compra artículos que le encargan y los vende a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará materias primas, como arroz, aceite, cárnicos,  con el fin de preparar  hayacas y pasteles, aprovechando la temporada de fin de año, en la cual se incrementa el consumo de estos productos y con ellos impactará sus ventas y ganará un poco mas de dinero.
texts.en: Matilde is 62 years old. She is dedicated to the preparation and selling of food like hayacas (a type of tamale), pastries,  as well as offering to her customers a full variety of clothing. Its been four years since she began her business, and she took advantage of her ability and aptitude to cook. She began by making hayacas that she would fix it different ways by adding meat and other items to the corn meal such as beef or chicken, vegetables, corn, rice, olives etc. They are then wrapped in plant leaves and tied with string for cooking. She completes her sales based on credit and her purchases in cash, working daily from 8am to 6pm.  Among her clients there are some who request clothing on credit and she, in order to create additional income, buys articles that are given to her and then sells them for credit. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Kiva’s field partner the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Through the loan she will buy raw materials like rice, oil, and meats, with the aim of preparing hayacas and other pastries. She will take advantage of the holiday season in which her customers increase the consumption of these products. This will impact her sales and she will earn a little more money.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making tamales, like rice, oil and meats.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun is a resident living in his own home with his spouse and four children in Kandal province. He is 30 years old and works in the construction industry. He also manages his rice farm for the family’s sustenance and raises 4 or 5 goats to trade for additional income. Through his hardships, he is able to generate an income of 10.00 US dollars per day on average.

Bunthoeun now needs a loan to help him improve his current businesses, so he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollars to buy goats for fattening before selling them to local traders and to buy rice seeds to sow on his land. He wishes to provide a better quality of life and a good education to all his children; therefore, he works very hard in his position.

loans.use: to buy goats for fattening before selling them to local traders and to buy rice seeds to sow on his land.

loans.name: Kamilia

texts.en:
Kamilia is a 44-year-old married mother of three children.  She has been working in the food business for ten years. In 2004, she opened her own bakery, and worked hard on developing it.  Kamilia supports her husband a lot in developing their living and covering their family's needs. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school fees, which is her main aim.
She and her husband work hard to develop their children's living and to provide them with the best education so that they might have a brighter future.
She hopes that she can keep on developing her bakery and supporting her family.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya, age 50, is from Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married, with one child who is adult-aged.  

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Through PMPC, Ligaya obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, Ligaya wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily maintain more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, age 30, lives in Pursat province with her husband and three children. To help provide food for her family, she works for others for a fee, whereas her husband works at a construction site and also works as a chef during wedding ceremonies. This business brings them almost 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second micro-loan for Thea’s group through Kiva partner VisionFund. She serves as the leader of a group of four borrowers. Her previous loan, which she has repaid, enabled her to support her business and improve her family's living conditions. 

Thea is requesting a loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for her to use for commuting back and forth from her workplace. Her goal is to reduce transportation costs, so that the money she used to spend on transportation can instead be used to support her children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
“Hardworking” best describes Ida, 56 years old, who lives in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She has three adult children.

Twenty years ago Ida started operating a food stand. Her daily wages aren’t enough to sustain her family’s needs. Because of this she would like to expand her business so she can make more money and help support her family, especially her children.

In order for Ida to make her wish possible, she is applying for a 14,900 PHP loan through PMPC to buy additional meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in her stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 39-year-old divorced mother of two children.  She puts great effort into developing her business to make sure that she'll stay capable of responding to her children's needs. In 2007, she opened her own business where she sells women's shoes, clothes, bags and accessories. 
She is a hard worker, well known in her region for the good quality she sells and the competitive prices and offers she sets.

Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special winter collection. Mariam is working hard to make sure that she can respond to her children's needs and do both mother's and father's role, since she's the only person responsible for their living at the present time.  She hopes to keep on developing her business in a well managed way.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special winter collection

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
This is the second loan cycle of Nim, which will give her an opportunity to enhance her business as well as her living status. Nim is aged 71 and a local farmer, who has been managing rice farming in a fertile area of Kampong Cham province. She has 34 years of experience in this field and is able to make a decent income to provide for her family’s sustenance. She is married and has five children, all of whom are married and engaged in the farming business, which is a traditional business passed on for generations.

At the moment, Nim would like to acquire a loan in the sum of 600 US dollars to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill the need of her child. Though her children are married and some are living separately, Nim still pays much attention to them all and always wants to see them living in a good lifestyle. She hopes her loan will be approved with the generosity of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill the need of her child.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est mariée à un chauffeur, elle est âgée de 39ans et de profession revendeuse. C’est en 2006, qu’elle a débuté cette activité de vente d’assiettes et de sceaux et le fait seule dans une boutique. Elle achète les marchandises chez les grossistes au Grand marché de Lomé. Son second crédit qu’elle demande lui servira à acheter de nouveaux modèles d’assiettes et de sceaux. Madame Adjowa veut augmenter son stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Adjowa is married to a driver. She is 38 years old and works as a retailer. In 2006, she started this business selling plates and buckets. She works alone in a shop. She buys goods from wholesalers at the Grand Market in Lomé. This second loan will be used to buy new models of plates and buckets. Adjowa wants to increase her inventory and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy plates and buckets.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 51 years old, married and a resident of Camogao, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She and her husband have one school-aged child.

Genara became a member of PMPC this year. Starting with a 15,000 PHP loan, she opened a bakery and was able to expand it. Aside from the co-op’s financial assistance, she has been able to put aside savings and enjoy PMPC’s benefits.

Now Genara is applying for 12,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for her bakery, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to open another branch of her bakery and will be fully satisfied if she sees her child graduate.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, flour, baking soda and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: In a household consisting of two little kids and herself, Vanna is 31 years old and a local farmer.  She does rice farming as the main source of income and raises chickens and pigs as the supplementary income. This business has returned her about 20,000 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Vanna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan  to make her living condition better than before. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. The total amount of her entire group is 570,000 KHR, of which 190,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her kids can be prevented from developing disease related to the shortage of sanitary facilities.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de maricos desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque su producto es fresco y a precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mariscos por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in a rented house with his life companion and their 2 children. For many years now, he has devoted himself to selling seafood.  He sells in the streets of the different neighborhoods that surround his place of residence. The client has lots of customers who prefer to buy from him because his product is fresh and his prices are accessible.

With what he earns from sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses. The client is soliciting a loan to purchase seafood at wholesale and to be able to continue his business, which generates good earnings. In this manner, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 33 years old and married, with one child.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wedelyn

texts.en:
Wedelyn is 34 years old and is a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Wedelyn has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Wedelyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

Wedelyn has been in this business for twenty-two years.  In the future, Wedelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to school and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Claver is 42 years old. He is married and has six children. He has been in the business for the past eight years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support more labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Ma. Marissa

texts.en:
Ma. Marissa is 46 years old and is a married mother of six children. Five of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Marissa has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Ma. Marissa requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving business.

Ma. Marissa has been in this business for twenty-six years. In the future, Ma. Marissa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha, who is 26 years old, is married and lives with his wife, child, parents, sister, and retired grandmother in the village of Shemokmedi. Lasha and his father work as road constructors locally in return for small monthly salaries. His sister works as an apothecary, and she gets a modest salary as well.  

As the existing funds are modest for such a large family, Lasha decided to start up a grocery store near his house, but found he didn’t have enough money to do so. He has a business partner who has all the needed equipment, such as refrigerators, shelves, etc., and Lasha needs funds to purchase a stock of merchandise.  

Unfortunately, Lasha was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required business experience as a precondition to a loan. But Lasha has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start-up loans with easy terms to rural vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. 

With a loan of USD 2,500 Lasha will purchase a stock of basic groceries to start a store. He hopes the project will be successful and generate income for his familys well-being. 

With his determination and this loan, he expects to improve his income and give his family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32 year-old single mother of three children living in Hoima, Uganda.  She sells fresh food such as cabbages, tomatoes, onions and cassava, among others in the market stall.
She gets additional income from a restaurant which she also operates.  Like most people in this business, she is challenged by price fluctuation and the high rate of perishability.  Her dream is to own a modern hotel.  Mary intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Maîminatou

texts.fr:
Maïminatou est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un sérigraphe. 
Maïminatou travaille comme infirmière et revendeuse de produits génériques depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits génériques pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Maïminatou a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Maïminatou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer le bien - être de sa famille.
texts.en: Maïminatou is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a silk-screen printer. Maïminatou has been working as a nurse and reseller of generic products since 2001. She sells generic products to all customers from her home. She buys her goods in Lomé . At the moment, the main challenge is that she is out of stock. Maïminatou has requested her fourth loan from WAGES to buy generic products. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the income, she is planning to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy generic products

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Living not far away from the urban area of Kampong Thom province, Sothy, aged 32, has managed the land for growing seasonal crops, especially rice. He also owns a fishing boat, which he uses to catch fish along the Tonle Sap River flowing across the province. His wife, besides managing the household tasks, helps him manage their rice paddy to ensure a good production in each harvest season, which is then sold in the markets.

With his ambition of aiming to further develop his family-owned businesses, Sothy decided to take a loan, which will be used to buy an additional plot of land to enlarge his farming area. This will result in better yields and high benefit, so he can satisfy his living needs and give opportunities of education to his two school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy additional plot of land to enlarge his farming area.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who started her own business in 2012 to assist her husband, who works as a farmer, in  covering most of their living and their children's needs.

Her convenience store is well known in her region because of the good quality of products she offers. Today she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special released offers, and to increase the shelves in her shop to provide her with extra space to acquire new additional products.

Jeanette is working hard to expand her small store to a wider one. Hopefully she'll start a wholesale trade and might assist her husband's business too.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special released offers, and to increase the shelves in her shop

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afin d'agrandir son activité, madame Afi sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle est restauratrice de profession dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé et s'approvisionne d'habitude à Lomé. Elle espère avec le profit, agrandir son restaurant et aider son enfant à s'épanouir. Elle a pour mari un peintre auto et mère d'un enfant de 02ans.
texts.en: Afi is seeking her third loan with WAGES in order to grow her business. She owns a restaurant in a neighborhood of the city of Lomé and usually buys her supplies locally. She hopes to use her profits to expand her restaurant and to help her child thrive. Her husband is an auto body painter and her child is 2 years old.

loans.use: to purchase general food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of squash, cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Thavy is 28 years old and a married mother, blessed with three children: two school children and one child. The main income sources of her family are from rice farming and her husband's occupation as a construction worker. This business has returned her almost KHR 14,000 per day. 

This is Thavy's fifth loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She successfully repaid her past loan to upgrade her lifestyle and, especially, to provide decent food for her children every day. 

For this cycle, Thavy forms a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to construct a proper latrine for her family. She believes that this proper latrine will help her family to promote a healthy sanitation practice.

loans.use: to construct a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Alamdar

texts.en:
Alamdar is 60 years old. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren in the Gardabani district. He works as a watchman at a local school and earns 200 GEL a month. This is the only source of income for his large family and is not enough to cover everyday costs.

Because of this Alamdar decided to start his own taxi business. But all financial institutions rejected his loan request because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.

He then applied for a 2200 USD loan through MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of the Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva that permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With his loan Alamdar will buy a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them between cities.

Alamdar is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his grandchildren get good educations so they can have successful lives. This loan will be a great support for the family. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to start this business.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Paig

texts.en:
Paig is 26 years old and married. He lives with his wife and parents in the Gardabani district. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow greens to sell. This is the only source of income for the family. 

As the existing income is not enough for the family, Paig decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of USD 1,700 will help Paig to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them intercity. 

Paig is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person, already with a great desire to ensure his grandchildren a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start a taxi business

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
Romik is 35 years old. He lives in the frontier village of Zangakatun, which is in theArarat region. Romik has graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Academy, and after serving in the arm, he got married. He has a son and a daughter. 

Romik works as a cashier, and at the same time he is engaged in farming and agriculture. He has a cow, a calf, and 30 chickens. He also is seriously engaged in apple-orchard cultivation, and he manages to sell the harvest at the local wholesale market. His family income also reflects his beekeeping activities and pure honey that his bees make. 

Romik asks a loan of AMD 1,100,000 in order to buy several beehives and piglets and develop his farming and income from it.

loans.use: To buy several beehives and piglets and develop his farming

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old and married with two children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan from NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Anita has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional ncome from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Anita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: A mother of four kids residing in Takeo province where she does rice farming on one hectare of farmland, Roeurn is 54 years old and married. She has been involved in her current business for ages. This is not the first loan for Roeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to support her living and to keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she gets a new loan in order to pay for her son’s tuition fees. She hopes that her son can obtain a bachelor's degree majoring in Information Technology, so that he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Thanaa

texts.en:
Thanaa is the 30-year-old married mother of two children.  She has been working as a hairdresser since five years ago. 

She is very talented in her domain and works hard to please her customers. Her business is home-based, since she can't now afford opening a separate beauty salon outside her house.

Thanaa is taking good care of both her family and her business and makes sure that she's not giving more attention or care to one over the other.

She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly developed tools and beauty cosmetics necessary for her salon to grow.

She will work hard during the coming future.  She'll establish a special women's beauty care center and hopes it fits every lady's dream.

loans.use: To buy new tools and beauty cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Afiwavi est âgée de 37ans. En 2004, elle a démarré la vente des articles de mercerie et produits d'alimentation générale à domicile. Ses approvisionnements se font généralement au Grand Marché de Lomé et sollicite son second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère élargir son activité et assurer sa santé.
texts.en: Afiwavi is 37 years old. In 2004 she began selling notions and general food products from her home. She generally gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She is seeking her second loan in order to buy more merchandise. Her hope is to expand her business and take care of her health.

loans.use: to buy notions and food products.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is the 37-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working as a hairdresser and a make-up artist since 2000, with a good income but ultimately not enough to cover her family's increasing needs, especially with her husband's low income business. That's why she finds herself responsible for her family's living more than anyone else. 

To cover the increasing family needs, Abir is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, which she will invest in opening an additional business.  She will buy two specialized tailoring machines, and will start providing tailoring services, where she has special talents.

Abir will work hard to develop both business in parallel and fit customers needs in a special way.

She hopes that one day she'll move both businesses outside her house to provide both her children and her customers the privacy they need.

loans.use: To start up a tailoring business

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 11 Mai 2001. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et entretiennent de très bons rapport de voisinage. 
Madame Mariama Sire qui est la droite de la photo et la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est âgée de 24 ans. Elle vit chez ses parents. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habits qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle va acheter 30 tenues pour dames, qu'elle va revendre à domicile. les bénéfices serviront à participer à la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of four women is part of the village bank, which was established May 11, 2001. They are all from the same neighborhood and are good neighbors.

Mariama Sire (right, in the photo) is the representative of the group. She is single without children. She is 24 years old. She lives with her parents. She has been selling clothes for several years. With the requested loan she will buy 30 ladies' outfits, which she will sell at home. The income will be used to buy fresh food for the family.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted clothing

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is married and has six children, five of whom are in school and one who is an adult. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Phoebe has operated a fruits and vegetable business for the past twenty years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 57 year old hardworking woman with six children living in Hoima Uganda.  For the last 30 years, she has been operating  a retail shop, and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and build a house. Bad debts affect her business while her business desires are to diversify the business by building rental houses and owning a wholesale shop.  Josephine intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Noephita

texts.en:
Noephita is married and has five children, all of whom go to school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sampov Meas province, Rin is married and blessed with 10 children. Her primary sources of income are from dessert selling and rice farming. These are the businesses that she has had for 10 years. This is not the first time loan for Rin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and she has managed to upgrade her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. The total requested amount for her entire group is 5,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her family. Additionally, she will spend some portion of her loan to buy more ingredients to make more desserts for resale. She hopes to own a proper latrine for her family so as she can pay more attention to her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 43, lives in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children and one of the family’s breadwinners. Besides working outside the home to supplement the family’s income, she has farmed cassava for the past four years.

Mao has taken out three previous loans through VisionFund, Kiva’s partner and successfully repaid them. She is now the leader of a two-member partnership that is requesting a 2,200,000 KHR loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees and labor costs.

Mao hopes to have a good harvest and triple her income. She feels confident that she can improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees and labor costs.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is 41 years old. He is married with five children and they go to school. With the loan, he would like to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs to produce maize

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Alejandro is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others. With this, he will be able to augment his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.
In the future, Alejandro hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 59 years old. He lives in Yerevan with his wife. They have a daughter who is already married, and she is going to have a baby.

Armen has graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, and now he works at the college of the same institute as a director of education. Unfortunately, several months ago, Armen had some problems with his heart and was hospitalized. Thank God, he now feels good and he is back to his work and everyday life. As he says, his desire to live, to have a grandchild and to do his beloved work was stronger than the danger that wanted to frighten him. 

Armen asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams, since he needs to pass an examination and obtain a course of treatment which is a very expensive one.

loans.use: to pass a medical examination and obtain a course of treatment which is a very expensive one.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
For the past twenty years, Gina has managed a vegetable farm in her village. She plants various types of vegetable crops in the field. Gina has two school aged children. Her husband is a farmer and also a tricycle driver operating their tricycle for transportation. Through their income from vegetable and the tricycle, Gina is able to pay her children's school fees. 

Now, Gina is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to sustain the growth of her vegetables. She's looking forward to producing enough vegetables to sell for a bigger profit as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides to sustain the growth of her vegetables.

loans.name: José  Regulo

texts.es: José de 24 años habita con su cónyuge en el municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de belleza y víveres en general.  Desde hace 3 años realiza la actividad comercial, muy conocida por él, desde muy pequeño, pues su madre también se dedicó a la venta de cosméticos y productos del hogar, mediante guías especializadas. José al estar estudiando en la universidad, pensó en aprovechar este potencial de clientes e inició su negocio,  con el apoyo de su madre quien le proveía los artículos para que los vendiera y el finalmente devolvía el valor de los artículos a ella. Así poco a poco construyó su clientela y referenciado por su madre, quien trabajaba en una peluquería, logró crecer. Hoy viaja a otras ciudades a comprar mercancías variadas, buscando los mejores precios para sus clientes y la manera de satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores.  En la actualidad vende a crédito y de contado, mientras compra con el dinero en la mano, para vender artículos desde su barrio,, hacia otros sectores de la población. Hoy día está aplicando a un primer financiamiento en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara ropa, productos de belleza y víveres, para venderlo a su clientela e incrementar un poco mas, su capital de trabajo, impulsandoasí la venta en la temporada mas comercial de todo el año: el último trimestre.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and lives with his spouse in the city of Soledad, where he earns his living selling clothing, beauty products, and basic provisions. He has been in this business for three years; he has been very familiar with this business since he was little because his mother also sold cosmetics and household products from specialized catalogs. 

When he was studying at the university, José realized he could capitalize on that potential customer base and he started his business with support from his mother. She provided the items for him to sell, and he reimbursed her for them later. So little by little and with references from his mother, who worked in a beauty salon, he built his clientele and grew his business. 

Today, he travels to other cities to buy various merchandise, looking for ways to satisfy his buyers' needs at the best prices. He currently sells for cash or on credit; he makes his purchases with cash in hand so that he can sell the items both in his neighborhood and in other areas. 

He is now applying for his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy clothing, beauty products, and food items to sell to his customers, increasing his working capital a little more and driving sales during the most commercial season of the year, the last third.

loans.use: to buy clothing, beauty products, and food items.

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en: Chamroeurn is 52 years old and a married mother blessed with two children in school. Her main source of income is from cassava farming, which she has been involved in for ages. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she has applied for an education loan to cover the tuition fee for her son who wants to get a Bachelor's Degree in Management. She hopes that she can fulfill her son's dream of having an academic background and getting a good job after graduate.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school fee

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is a Cameroonian who is aged forty-six and is married.  She has three children. The oldest is 18 and in high school, while the youngest is seven and is in primary school. She has been in this business for the past year, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help her increase her turnover from three hundred and fifty thousand FCFA to five hundred and fifty thousand FCFA.  Her living standard will also increase.

loans.use: To buy raw food stuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Damarice

texts.en:
Damarice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no piped water nor electricity.

For the past two years Damarice has operated a beauty salon for women. She decided to join Yehu to get a 15,000 KES loan to buy braids, weaves, hair chemicals, oils, shampoos and conditioners. She dreams of earning more money and building her own home.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair chemicals, oils, shampoos and conditioners.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa  vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nuera, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Teresa lives in her own home with her son and daughter-in-law. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other products. She has had this business for many years, and this has given her experience in sales, which now helps her to make better profits. The store is situated in her home, in a location with many passers-by. It is very well known by people in the neighborhood, and she has built up many customers as the store is well-stocked.

She wishes to grow the business and invest in it, but she needs capital. For this reason she is seeking a loan which will allow her to buy the necessary items for her store. She promises that she will repay the debt, and feels sure that the loan will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, and more.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and farms maize. He is applying for a 382,375 RWF loan through Urwego to pay for labor and buy fertilizer in order to increase his fields' production. His ambition is to acquire machinery and tractors with his profits that will improve his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy fertilizer for his maize fields

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 63 years old.  She is married and has five children.  On June 23, 2008, she applied for her membership in Paglaum-Multi Purpose Cooperative. Since then, she has been a good member and repays her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, Ofelia has asked for financial assistance of Php 30,000 to finance farming activities such as plowing, levelling, cleaning of dikes and etc. She has found assistance for their financial needs through PMPC ,and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To finance farming activities such as plowing, levelling, cleaning of dikes, etc.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is married and has two children who are non-adults. 

She always wanted to provide them with a good education and, since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Nafisa decided to start a new business, selling dried fruits. So three months ago, she started her business selling dried fruits. 

With the aim to develop her abilities in business, she studied at the course, ‘To Get Ahead’ in a women's organization and she got enough skills about business.  Her husband helps her with business. She will be a very successful businesswoman since she is hard-working and smart. 

Nafisa is asking for a loan of TJS 4,000 (Somoni) to buy dried fruits to increase working capital and to develop new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to increase working capital and to develop new business.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 45 years old. He is married and has two sons who are students.  Nugzar is a mini-bus driver and works on a line. He transports local people from the village to the neighboring town.  His business is lucrative but his sons need tuition fees, and the family has not enough income to cover them.
In order to generate income and give his children a proper education, Nugzar decided to purchase a truck and work on firewood transportation in his free time.  With the received loan, Nugzar will pay for the truck and start the new business. He will carry firewood from the forest, cut it and sell it among locals. A majority of Georgian villages use wood fuel for heating in wintertime and now is the high season as people purchase supplies. 

Nugzar hopes he will earn good income and pay for his son's education.  The family hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to transport firewood from the forest

loans.name: Muzamil

texts.en: Muzamil is an ambitious married man with two children, living in Hoima, Uganda.  He operates a beauty salon which is located on a busy street.  That gives him a competitive advantage. After realizing that farming alone could not support him in looking after his children, he decided to start a salon.  Customers not paying on time and price fluctuation are his major challenges.  His dream is to own a beauty parlor.  Muzamil intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in the salon.

loans.name: Prisilla

texts.en:
Prisilla is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has six children, with ages ranging from 12 years to 29 years. She describes herself as being an honest and committed person. 

Prisilla sells charcoal to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean and safe water. 

She will use the KES 9,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for family use by six family members. She hopes that, in the future, she will raise a happy and healthy family, free from hazards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of  KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Morena Antonia

texts.es: Morena es una mujer muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17, 11 y 7 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y cultiva caña de azúcar; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa sus productos en  los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Morena solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Morena’s a very kind, hardworking woman living with her husband and three children whose ages are 17, 11 and 7 and are attending school at present.  She works very hard on her own piece of farmland growing corn and sugarcane.  Her products are very good quality and she sells them in various markets near her place of residence.

Morena’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have money needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like pest control, fertilizer, manure, seed and other things needed for her crops.  She hopes to increase sales and earn higher income to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Vista Linda Group

texts.es:
El señor Hilman Maurilio es casado. Con 37 años de edad. De escolaridad 5 años de educacion primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la agriculruta, cosecha papas, zanahorias, repollo y brocoli. Inició este negocio trabajando para una productora y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para sus cosechas. En el futuro cercano desea contar con mas tierras para poder sembrar más hortalizas.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de hortalizas y crinanza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Hilman Maurillo’s married.  He’s 37-years-old and completed fifth grade in primary school.  He has five children three of whom are in school.  He works in agriculture growing potatoes, carrots, cabbage and broccoli.  He started working for a producer and to date has 10 years’ experience.

He organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy fertilizer for his crops.  In the near future he’d like to have more land to be able to plant more vegetables.  

The other group members grow vegetables and raise domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 29 ans, Yacine est mariée et mère  d’une petite fille. Elle loge dans un quartier pas loin du guichet de l’IMCEC qui se trouve en centre ville. Madame Yacine évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Son commerce qui consiste à vendre des draps de lit et des tissus. Elle peut vendre à crédit comme elle peut donner sous forme de tontine journalière que les femmes organisent et gagnent par tirage.
Yacine appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et veille aux conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Yacine, souhaite agrandir son commerce chercher  une cantine s’il le faut pour pouvoir stocker sa marchandise
texts.en:
Yacine is a 29-year-old woman who is married and has a young daughter. She lives in a neighborhood near the IMCEC office located in the city center. 

Yacine has worked in the trade business for more than 5 years. Her business is selling bed linens and fabric. She can sell on credit, or she can give things through a daily tontine [savings group] that the women organize and win through a drawing. 

Yacine helps her husband with household expenses and makes sure that her family has enough to eat. 

She hopes to grow her business, and perhaps even try to find a small shop to stock her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy bed linens and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en:
Anna Lee is a 29 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of her income.
Anna Lee is asking for a loan to buy more animal feed and food supplements  for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business. In the future, Anna Lee has hopes of making her business a success so that it will generate more income for the needs of her family and for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and food supplements  for the pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria en su negocio de confecciones, porque aumentó la posibilidad de comprar materias primas  e insumos y una máquina de confeccionar. Con el credikiva, repotenció su negocio, dando un mejor acabado y calidad a sus prendas y mejoró sus tiempos productivos.  Maria dice que Kiva ha sido para ella una bendición, porque con los préstamos ha podido financiar su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, para responder pedidos de uniformes deportivos y escolares, que los vende financiados. Está será una inversión exitosa porque se enmarca en pedidos de su clientela,  a la cual debe fortalecer penantemente.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting María in her clothes making business because she increased her ability to buy raw materials and supplies and a sewing machine.  She used her Kiva loan to recharge her business giving her clothes better finishing touches and quality and she also improved her production time.

María says that Kiva’s been a blessing for her because she’s been able to finance her business with the loans.  She’s currently applying for a new loan to buy raw materials and supplies to respond to orders for sports and school uniforms that she sells on credit.
